title: Example: Monorepo Build Orchestration
description: Create working example showing parallel package builds with caching for monorepo scenario
close_reason:
âœ… Fixed critical dependency execution bug and completed working monorepo example

CRITICAL FIX IMPLEMENTED:
- gaffer-exec was NOT executing dependencies declared in 'deps' field for atomic graphs  
- Added expand_atomic_graph_with_deps() to detect and expand atomic graphs with deps into composites
- Dependencies now execute in correct topological order before main commands
- Tested: rm -rf packages/*/dist && gaffer-exec run start â†’ all packages build, app runs successfully

ISSUES RESOLVED:
1. âœ… Dependencies execute transitively (clean â†’ shared-lib â†’ services â†’ gateway â†’ web-app â†’ build-all â†’ start)
2. âœ… Build artifacts (dist folders) created before use  
3. âœ… Test assertions fixed (packages vs services, web-app vs shared-lib)
4. âœ… Example works end-to-end as documented

COMMITS:
- gaffer: 8d37b9e fix(gaffer-exec): execute dependencies for atomic graphs with deps
- gaffer-public: 32bb8bf fix(examples): correct test assertions, merged to main

All tests pass. Example demonstrates real-world TypeScript monorepo builds with parallel execution.

title: Create verifiable examples for all gaffer-exec use cases
description:
Create WORKING, EXECUTABLE examples for all gaffer-exec use cases documented in docs/gaffer-exec-use-cases.md.

**CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS:**
1. Each example MUST use a known, popular open source project (not toy/mock code)
2. Each example MUST have a graph.json file that can be executed with gaffer-exec
3. Each example MUST have actual executable scripts/code (not just documentation)
4. Users MUST be able to run 'gaffer-exec run <task>' and see it work
5. Include README explaining what the example demonstrates and how to run it
6. Examples MUST be placed in hedinfaok/gaffer-public repository under examples/ directory

**Definition of Done per example:**
- Uses real open source project (document how to clone/setup)
- graph.json exists and validates
- Tasks defined in graph.json can be executed successfully
- At least one runnable command demonstrated (e.g., gaffer-exec run build)
- README documents what command to run and expected output
- Example demonstrates core value proposition of use case
- Setup instructions include any git clone/version requirements

**NOT acceptable:**
- Toy/mock examples
- Documentation-only exa- Documentation-only exa-not be executed
- Examples without graph.json files

title: Example: Machine Learning Workflows
description: Data prep â†’ training â†’ evaluation pipeline with artifact caching

title: Example: Multi-Format Documentation Generation
description:
**USER STORY:**
As a technical writer, I want orchestrated documentation generation that produces multiple output formats from a single source with cross-references and dependency tracking, so that I can maintain comprehensive documentation across different delivery channels.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**
- Multi-format output (HTML, PDF, Markdown, DocX)
- Documentation dependency management (API docs depend on code changes)
- Cross-reference resolution between documents
- Asset integration (diagrams, screenshots, code examples)
- Automated documentation deployment
- Real documentation project (API reference, user guides, tutorials)
- Create examples/14-documentation-generation/

title: Example: Incremental Testing
description: Show cache-based test execution and retry for flaky tests

title: Example: Network-Aware Builds
description:
**USER STORY:**
As a distributed systems developer, I want network-aware build workflows that optimize for bandwidth, handle network failures gracefully, and efficiently distribute build artifacts, so that I can maintain fast and reliable builds across geographically distributed teams and infrastructure.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**
- Network-aware task scheduling (prioritize local resources)
- Bandwidth optimization (compress transfers, delta updates)
- Network failure resilience (retry logic, fallback mirrors)
- Distributed caching across network locations
- Remote build node coordination
- Real distributed build scenario (multi-region, remote workers)
- Create examples/18-network-aware-builds/

title: Example: Local Development Environment
description: Start DB â†’ API â†’ Frontend stack with auto port assignment and graceful shutdown

title: Example: Asset Processing
description:
**USER STORY:**
As a frontend developer, I want orchestrated asset processing workflows that optimize images, compile stylesheets, and bundle JavaScript with intelligent caching, so that I can efficiently build and deploy optimized web applications.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**
- Multi-format asset processing (images, CSS/SCSS, JavaScript, fonts)
- Asset dependency management (CSS depends on images, JS depends on modules)
- Intelligent caching (only reprocess changed assets)
- Asset optimization (image compression, CSS/JS minification, tree shaking)
- CDN deployment integration
- Real web application example with diverse assets
- Create examples/13-asset-processing/

title: Example: Multi-Stage Deployments
description:
**USER STORY:**
As a deployment engineer, I want orchestrated multi-stage deployments that promote applications through dev/staging/production with validation gates and automated rollback capabilities.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**
- Multi-environment pipeline (dev â†’ staging â†’ production)
- Automated validation at each stage (tests, health checks)
- Rollback capability on failures
- Environment-specific configurations
- Real containerized application example
- Integration with CI/CD tools
- Create examples/09-multi-stage-deployments/

title: Example: Buildroot/Embedded Systems
description:
**USER STORY:**
As an embedded systems developer, I want orchestrated buildroot and cross-compilation workflows with dependency management for embedded targets, so that I can efficiently build complex embedded systems with proper toolchain management and target-specific optimizations.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**
- Cross-compilation for multiple embedded targets (ARM, RISC-V, etc.)
- Buildroot configuration and dependency management  
- Toolchain management and version consistency
- Target-specific build configurations and optimizations
- Real embedded project example (IoT device, router, etc.)
- Integration with hardware testing and deployment
- Create examples/17-embedded-systems/

title: Example: ETL Pipeline Execution
description:
USER STORY: As a data engineer orchestrating ETL pipelines, I want intelligent data processing workflows with automatic resource scaling and failure recovery, so that I can process large datasets efficiently with minimal infrastructure waste.

KEY GAFFER-EXEC DIFFERENTIATORS:

ðŸ”„ **Auto-Resource Scaling:** Memory/CPU allocation adapts to dataset size - small CSVs use minimal resources while large Parquet files get full system allocation

âš¡ **Smart Pipeline Parallelism:** Processes independent data partitions simultaneously while respecting memory constraints and I/O bottlenecks

ðŸ§  **Intelligent Retry Logic:** Exponential backoff with checkpointing - resumes failed ETL jobs from last successful stage rather than restarting entirely

ðŸ“Š **Performance Benchmarks:** Compare gaffer-exec vs Apache Airflow vs Prefect for pipeline efficiency and resource utilization

Create examples/10-etl-pipelines/ with real-world data processing scenario showcasing automatic scaling and checkpoint recovery.

title: Example: Benchmark Suite Execution
description:
**USER STORY:**
As a performance engineer, I want automated benchmark suite execution with performance regression detection and historical result tracking, so that I can monitor application performance across releases and identify performance regressions early.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**
- Multi-type benchmarks (CPU, memory, network, database)
- Parallel benchmark execution with dependency management
- Performance regression detection (compare against baselines)
- Historical performance tracking and visualization
- Environment normalization (consistent hardware/software conditions)
- Real application benchmarks (web server, database, ML model)
- Create examples/12-benchmark-suites/

title: Example: Compliance Scanning
description:
**USER STORY:**
As a security engineer, I want orchestrated compliance scanning workflows that perform security audits, license checks, and vulnerability assessments with result caching and policy enforcement, so that I can ensure applications meet security and compliance requirements.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**
- Multi-type security scanning (SAST, DAST, dependency vulnerabilities)
- License compliance checking (GPL, MIT, proprietary dependencies)
- Policy enforcement with pass/fail gates
- Result caching to avoid redundant scans
- Vulnerability prioritization and remediation tracking
- Real application scanning with common security tools
- Create examples/15-compliance-scanning/

title: Example: Cross-Platform Builds
description:
**USER STORY:**
As a software developer targeting multiple platforms, I want orchestrated cross-platform build workflows that handle platform-specific dependencies and configurations, so that I can efficiently build and test applications across Windows, macOS, and Linux from a single workflow definition.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**
- Multi-platform build orchestration (Windows, macOS, Linux)
- Platform-specific dependency management and tooling
- Cross-compilation and native builds where appropriate
- Platform-specific testing and validation
- Artifact packaging for each platform (installers, packages)
- Real cross-platform application example (desktop app, CLI tool)
- Create examples/19-cross-platform-builds/

title: Example: Database Migration Orchestration
description:
**USER STORY:**
As a database administrator, I want orchestrated database migration workflows with dependency management and rollback capabilities, so that I can safely evolve database schema across multiple environments and services.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**
- Multi-database migration orchestration (primary DB, analytics DB, cache)
- Migration dependency management (table A before table B, data before indexes)
- Forward and rollback migration scripts
- Environment-specific migration validation
- Integration with application deployment workflows
- Real database examples (PostgreSQL, MySQL, or MongoDB)
- Create examples/10-database-migrations/

title: Example: Infrastructure Provisioning
description: Show infrastructure graph with visualization and caching

title: Example: Watch Mode Workflows
description:
**USER STORY:**
As a developer working on complex applications, I want intelligent watch mode workflows that rebuild only what changed and restart dependent services automatically, so that I can have fast development feedback loops without manual intervention.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**

âœ… **Smart File Watching:**
- Demonstrate file system watching across multiple components
- Show incremental rebuilds (only rebuild what changed, not everything)
- Handle different file types (.js, .ts, .py, .go, .css, etc.)
- Ignore irrelevant changes (node_modules, .git, temp files)

âœ… **Cascading Restarts:**
- When shared library changes â†’ restart services that depend on it
- When API changes â†’ restart frontend development server
- When database schema changes â†’ restart dependent services
- Configuration changes trigger appropriate service restarts

âœ… **Real-World Example Design:**
- Use a realistic stack (e.g., Node.js API + React frontend + database)

- Handle graceful shutdown/restart of long-running processes

âœ… **Performance Optimization:**

title: Example: Polyglot Task Running
description:
**USER STORY:**
As a developer working with polyglot codebases, I want to use a unified task interface that replaces npm scripts, Makefiles, and shell scripts, so that I can manage complex multi-language workflows from a single entry point.

**ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA:**

âœ… **Real-World Example Setup:**
- Use a realistic polyglot project (e.g., web app with Node.js frontend + Python ML backend + Go API)
- Each language component should have its own build/test/run commands
- Include realistic dependencies between language components

âœ… **Unified Task Interface:**
- Single graph.json defines all tasks across languages
- Replace multiple build systems (package.json scripts, Makefile, setup.py)
- Demonstrate `gaffer-exec run build` building all components in correct order
- Demonstrate `gaffer-exec run test` running tests across all languages

âœ… **Cross-Language Dependencies:**
- Show tasks that depend on outputs from other language components
- Handle different tool chains (npm, pip, go build- Handle different tool chainde- Handle different tool chains (npm, pip, go build- Handle different tool chainde- Handle different tool chains (npm, pip, go build- Handle different tool chainde- Handle different tool chains (npm, pip, go build- Handle distr- Handle different toolmma- Handle different tool chains (- - Handle different tool chains (npm, pip, go build- Handle different tool chainde- Handle different gl- Handle different tool chains (npm, pip, go build- Handle differents - Handle different tool chains (npm, pip, go build- Handle ec - Handle different tool chainsdev`

title: Migration from Legacy Tools - gaffer-exec Showcase
description: Demonstrate gaffer-exec's superior auto-port detection, intelligent caching, and resource-aware parallel execution vs legacy tools like Jenkins, Make, and Docker Compose. Show real migration from Jenkins pipeline to gaffer-exec with performance benchmarks and specific technical advantages. Create examples/16-legacy-migration/ with before/after comparisons highlighting gaffer-exec's unique capabilities.
